revisions.rev:
{{Infobox musical artist |name = Eliza Doolittle |alias = Eliza Doolittle |image = Eliza Doolittle August 2010.jpg |alt = |caption = |image_size = |background = solo_singer |birth_name = Eliza Sophie Caird |Born = {{birth date and age|1988|04|15|df=y}}
[[City of Westminster|Westminster]], [[London]], [[United Kingdom|UK]] |origin = |genre = [[Indie pop]], [[Folk music|folk]], [[ska]] |occupation = [[Singer-songwriter]] |years_active = 2007-present |instrument = [[Vocals]], [[piano]] |Magnum_opus = |associated_acts = |website = {{URL|http://www.elizadoolittle.com}} }} '''Eliza Sophie Caird''' (born 15 April 1988),{{cite web|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/info/eliza_doolittle|title=Eliza Doolittle Biography|accessdate=29 December 2010}} better known by her stage name '''Eliza Doolittle''', is an [[English people|English]] [[singerâsongwriter]] from [[London]], who signed to the [[Parlophone]] record label in October 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.rivmixx.com/interview/show/17555|title=Interview: Eliza Doolittle|date=05-07-2010|accessdate=29 December 2010}} Her debut self-titled album, ''[[Eliza Doolittle (album)|Eliza Doolittle]]'' was released on 12 July 2010, where it debuted at number 3 in the UK. Since the album's release, Doolittle has spawned two top 25 hits, including "[[Skinny Genes]]" and "[[Pack Up]]", which debuted within the top 5 on the [[UK Singles Chart]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/music/artists/c45c1037-5469-420c-ac21-83841efd815d|publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation|accessdate=2010-10-30|title=Eliza Doolittle at BBC Music}} ==Early Life== Eliza Doolittle was born in [[City of Westminster|Westminster]], London in 1988.{{cite web|url=http://www.findmypast.co.uk/birth-indexes-search-start.action |title=Births England and Wales 1837-2006 |publisher=Findmypast.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-07-13}} She comes from a family with a successful and varied musical background, Her father is [[John Caird (director)|John Caird]],{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/10600745|title=Talking Shop: Eliza Doolittle|last=Savage|first=Mark|date=2010-07-13|work=BBC News|accessdate=29 December 2010}} an English stage director and writer of plays, musicals and operas who is also an Honorary Associate Director of the [[Royal Shakespeare Company]]. Her mother is English musical theatre actress and recording artist [[Frances Ruffelle]], who won a [[Tony Award]] for her role of [[Ãponine]] in the English language version of [[Les MisÃ©rables]]. Doolittle is the granddaughter of [[Sylvia Young]], who founded her theatre school in 1981. She has eight siblings. Her parents separated when she was four years old.{{cite web|author=06:30 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00wbqzs |title=Radio 1 Programmes - The Chris Moyles Show, Wednesday - with Eliza Doolittle |publisher=BBC |date=2010-12-08 |accessdate=2011-07-13}} Doolittle grew up in [[Camden Town]] and attended [[Channing School For Girls]] and [[Westminster Kingsway College]]. She was used to being around stages and seeing her mother singing, (Ruffelle represented the UK in the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] in 1994, when Doolittle was 6 years old){{cite web|url=http://www.4music.com/artist/eliza-doolittle/pack-up.html|title=VIP track: Eliza Doolittle|date=098-05-2010|accessdate=29 December 2010}} she had always wanted to become a recording artist and write music. She chose the stage name of ''Eliza Doolittle'', the ''[[My Fair Lady]]'' character, because it was her nickname as a child. ==Musical career== ===Career Beginnings=== Before entering the charts, Doolittle toured the UK with her band to gain recognition. This later turned into the "Playground Unplugged" tour where she performed at secondary schools [[Kingsdale School]], [[Hagley RC High School]], [[The Magna Carta School]], [[The Bewdley School and Sixth Form Centre]], Fairfield High School, [[Highworth Grammar School]] and [[Presdales School]].{{citation needed|date=December 2010}} The first release from Doolittle is a self-titled EP that features four tracks 'Rollerblades', 'Moneybox', 'Police Car' and 'Go Home'. This was released on 29 November 2009. Tracks from the EP were remixed by [[Plastic Little (band)|Plastic Little]] ('Rollerblades'), [[Sam Young DJ|Sam Young]] and Jamie from [[The xx]] ('Money Box'). The EP received radio plays from [[Rob Da Bank]], [[Nick Grimshaw]],{{citation|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/nickgrimshaw/tracklistingarchive.shtml?20091104|title=Wednesday 4th November}} [[Fearne Cotton]] and [[Jo Whiley]]. ===2010-Present: Eliza Doolittle=== In early 2010, she took part in musician [[Shane MacGowan]]'s charity single "[[I Put a Spell on You]]", in aid of the [[2010 Haiti earthquake]].{{cite web|url =http://www.prefixmag.com/media/shane-macgowan-and-friends/i-put-a-spell-on-you-haiti-charity-song-video/37970/|title = Shane MacGowan and Friends "I Put a Spell On You" (Haiti Charity Song) (Video)|work = Prefix magazine|accessdate = 2011-03-07}} Her debut single "[[Skinny Genes]]" was released on 12 April 2010. The song had featured in a television advert for an online retailer.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvadmusic.co.uk/2010/03/very-co-uk-%E2%80%93-discover-spring/|title=Very.co.uk â Discover Spring|accessdate=29 December 2010}} She told [[BBC]]'s [[Steve Lamacq]] the song is "a funny scenario if you didnât like someone, if they were really annoying, but you had a good time under the sheets."{{cite web|url = http://www.songfacts.com/detail.php?id=18900|title = Skinny Genes|work = Songfacts.com|accessdate = 2010-03-26}} Doolittle's second release is entitled "[[Pack Up]]" and released on 5 July 2010, reaching #5 on the Official UK Singles Chart on 11 July 2010.{{cite web|author=Praxis Media |url=http://www.radio1.gr/music/forthcoming_uk_singles.htm |title=Radio1 Rodos Greece ::: UK Forthcoming Singles ::: Charts, DJ Promos, Dance, Lyrics, Free Mp3 Samples Downloads |publisher=Radio1.gr |date= |accessdate=2010-12-03}} [[Image:Eliza Doolittle August 2011 B.jpg|thumb|right|Doolittle performing in the [[Q-music]] studios in May 2011]] She recorded the song "Running For Life" which featured on the soundtrack to the film [[AdULTHOOD]].{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}} Doolittle was a special guest on [[Paloma Faith]]'s concert tour which began on 30 October 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.hitthefloor.co.uk/reviews/live-reviews/review-paloma-faith-eliza-doolittle-pavilions-plymouth-041110/|title=Live ReviewsPopReview: Paloma Faith & Eliza Doolittle â Pavilions, Plymouth â 04/11/10|last=Hines|first=Chris|date=05-11-2010|accessdate=29 December 2010}} She has performed on the companion show to [[Channel 4]]'s ''[[Big Brother (UK)|Big Brother]]'', ''[[Big Brother's Little Brother]]''.{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}} She appeared on BBC's ''[[Never Mind the Buzzcocks]]''. In March 2011 she performed at the [[South by Southwest]] festival in [[Austin, Texas]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2011}} In April 2011, Doolittle was touring the U.K. On 19 April 2011, Eliza's self-titled album was released in the United States almost one year from the U.K date. In 2011 [[Arte]] commissioned her to cover [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]]'s ''[[Material Girl]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.ladyobama.com/2011/07/eliza-doolittle-covers-madonna-material-girl/#axzz1RYka4JtK |title=Eliza Doolittle covers Madonna â Material Girl |publisher=LadyObama.com |date=2011-07-08 |accessdate=2011-07-13}} ==Modelling career== In 2010, Doolittle was made an 'ambassador' for a [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]] running game and did some modeling work to promote the concept in [[London]].{{cite web|url=http://www.vogue.co.uk/news/daily/101019-eliza-doolittle-talks-lily-allen.aspx|title=Our Fair Lady|last=Alexander|first=Ella|date=2010-10-19|work=Vogue|accessdate=19 January 2011}} In January 2011 it was announced that Doolittle had been signed by London based [[Select Model Management|Select Models]], the agency that launched the career of [[Sienna Miller]].{{cite web|url=http://www.vogue.co.uk/news/daily/110120-eliza-doolittle-signs-with-select-m.aspx|title=Singer-Turned-Model|last=Milligan|first=Lauren|date=2011-01-20|work=Vogue|accessdate=19 January 2011}} Doolittle told [[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]] that she does not believe she looks like a model, but hoped that the signing would help raise her profile.{{cite web|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/showbiz/853720-eliza-doolittle-moves-on-from-brits-snub-by-landing-modelling-job |title=Eliza Doolittle lands modeling job |publisher=Metro.co.uk |date=2011-01-25 |accessdate=2011-07-13}} == Discography == ===Albums=== {|class=wikitable style=text-align:center; |- ! rowspan=2| Year ! rowspan=2| Album details ! colspan=8| Chart peak positions ! rowspan=2| [[Music recording sales certification|Certifications]]
